pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:0.5: 80. The training rule on lack of permission
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā gave the full admission to a trainee nun who had not been given permission by her parents and her husband.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.4: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to that trainee nun without our permission?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of the parents and the husband.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.7: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to a trainee nun who doesn’t have permission from her parents and her husband?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.11: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.14.1: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has not been given permission by her parents or her husband, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.6: the biological parents is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.9: Who has not been given permission:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.12: one who has trained for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.15: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.16: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.17: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.18: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.19: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.2: if she gives her the full admission without knowing;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.3: if she gives her the full admission after getting permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.6: The tenth training rule is finished.
